Hey Jeff,

It's my understanding that your team does not utilize Salesforce Chatter, so I am emailing from the support ticket. 

Do you have the customer contact details for me to add to the support case so I can work directly with the client to resolve the issue at hand?

Thank you,

Tay Caliguiri

Senior Technical Support Engineer

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000Ici45:ref


Hi Tay,

 

Neither scan succeeded, and all the different scan types were only attempted due to the failure of the default scan modes failing. Endpoint security was supposed to have been turned off, and was checked multiple times throughout.

 

Are we able to get a resource on a call with the customer where we can execute the scan in any way you'd like. I've exhausted all of my tools/tricks, and this has been dragged out fairly long because of the customer.

 

 



	
		
			
			 

			
			
			
			 
			
			
			Jeff Forsyth

			Enterprise Solutions Engineer

			M: (201)739-2819

			Jeff Forsyth
			
		
	


 

 


 

 


From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: Tuesday, March 4, 2025 11:39
To: Jeffrey Forsyth <jeff.forsyth@netwrix.com>
Cc: Kyle Vogley <kyle.vogley@netwrix.com>
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #427819 - - 00427819 - NEA SEEK - SDD Data not returned [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Ici45:ref ]

 


Hey Jeff,

Dev needs a bit more clarity on how the collection was verified by running against the localhost:

	Was the local mode scan only used when targeting the localhost, or was PSFS01 targeted using local mode scans?
	If PSFS01 used both local and remote scans, did the local mode scan succeed?


Remote scanning uses the target host as a proxy if the target host is a Windows server, so if local mode scans are succeeding and remote scans are failing it would indicate that the problem is on the execution host. The logs indicate the FSAAScanHost.exe is being terminated during the scan, so I am trying to determine if the issue is specific to the execution host or if this issue is present regardless of the execution host.

Dev would also like to know if there is any endpoint security software in the customer's environment that could be killing FSAAScanHost.exe, because this has been the cause for issues in the past with similar symptoms.

Thank you,

Tay Caliguiri

Senior Technical Support Engineer
__________________ _________
Cybersecurity That Works for You

300 Spectrum Ctr Dr #200, Irvine, CA 92618
www.netwrix.com

I apologize for not having any updates, we are trying to work it out from the sales end and with the partner for what the best next steps are. This has been a protracted process because of them, EoY's for both companies, and how this issue has had no apparent resolution. There is no surprise here though, I don't normally come knocking unless there is an actual issue.

The partner and ourselves are keeping it on life supportfor the time being, and will update once we are able to engage again. Thank you for continuing to check-in and work with us Tay!

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #427819 - ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000Ici45:ref - 00427819 - NEA SEEK - SDD Data not returned

TextBody:
Hi Jeff,

At this time we have not received recent or artifacts demonstrating a true failure of Netwrix Enterprise Auditor.  We have seen evidence of the scan abruptly ending. We asked and did not receive any indication from you if there were sudden resource spikes around this time.

We have been unable to to identify any indication of malfuction except for this abrupt ending which may be cause by any number of external factors.

A fix was published in December 2024 for the Senstive Data add-on where resource consumption would grow unexpected and the scan would produce and out of memory or similar errors then crash. NEA 11.6.0.125 and SDD 11.6.0.14. We would need to know the most recent build of NEA nad the SDD Add-on to determine that this fix is implemented.

If you are able to provide further results of a recent scan or include Tay in a meeting with the customer we can continue to investigate with you.

Thank you,

Brandon West
Technical Support Manager
Phone: 1-949-407-5125 | Toll-free: 888-638-9749
____________________ __________
Powerful Data Security Made Easy

6160 warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
www.netwrix.com

I understand we were mired in trying to collect the logs around 'December 2024' when the suggested fix came out, but when was it identified as a possible solution for us to try for this particular issue? At this time we have not received recent or artifacts demonstrating a true failure of Netwrix Enterprise Auditor.  We have seen evidence of the scan abruptly ending. We asked and did not receive any indication from you if there were sudden resource spikes around this time.

We have been unable to to identify any indication of malfuction except for this abrupt ending which may be cause by any number of external factors.

A fix was published in December 2024 for the Senstive Data add-on where resource consumption would grow unexpected and the scan would produce and out of memory or similar errors then crash.
